fields.description:
The current EyeQL 'on branch' clause search commits that are committed on the branch only:
{noformat} select revisions from dir "/" where (on branch testbranch and comment matches "commit on testbranch") order by date desc group by changeset return path, revision, author, date, csid 
{noformat}
The above EyeQL return the changesets that are committed on testbranch.

After testbranch is merged into master branch, the search for the same commits on master branch does not work:
{noformat} select revisions from dir "/" where (on branch master and comment matches "commit on testbranch") order by date desc group by changeset return path, revision, author, date, csid
{noformat}
The above EyeQL does not return any result. 

We need EyeQL to perform search for the changesets (committed on the branch or merged into the branch) when using 'on branch' clause
fields.summary: Improve EyeQL 'on branch' clause

fields.description:

Because currently the author can reply to the reviewer's comment but reviewer may skip the email about the author's comment in bunch of emails and won't provide the reply back. After some time (e.g. in a week) the author may consider that everything is fine if no more comments were added and close the review. This is not right.
fields.summary: Uncomplete reviewer automatically if reply to their comment was added

fields.description: Customer reported issues with slow git repository indexing (CRC-5218).  Further investigation shown that git output splitting on new line characters can be very slow.  Seems like a regression introduced by FE-4203, processing large git diff output is significantly slower.

fields.description:
We have a git repository that was migrated from svn which was migrated from cvs.  The history is really convoluted and there are a lot of directories in the repo that are there only for historical reasons.  I first tried to index our repo using Fisheye and let it run for 8 days before I decided to restart the entire index process with exclusions in place to speed it up.  Now, it looks like it is actually slower.  I'm on day 8 now of the second index and it is not as far as it was in the first index (first index had over 100 branches indexed by day 8, second index has only 5).

It doesn't look like the excluded paths are speeding it up at all and I'm beginning to thing that it is actually slowing it down.

In the "Recent Activity", I see a lot of "git diff --no-renames --no-abbrev --full-index -U0" commands.  Many of them go really fast but there are a few that take minutes to hours.  I've ran a few of these commands and looked out the resulting output.  In many cases, every single file that was diffed in that command is an excluded file.  Why should it take minutes to discover that all the diffed files are to be excluded?  One example had 4586 files (all should be excluded) and it took over 40 minutes.  I turned on debug and it looks like it is parsing the diff before deciding that it should ignore the file.  That feels backwards.

And each time it indexes a new branch, it goes over these exact same changes and takes just as long.

I've enabled --Xdisable-head-detection, --Xdisable-tags, and --Xenable-git-content-hash-resolving-heuristic.
fields.summary: Excluded paths do not speed up FishEye's git indexing (and possibly slow it down)

fields.description:
[i couldn't find a JIRA for it, surprised if this isn't filed yet.  Please close this and link me if it exists]

This request is to allow Fisheye to import groups from LDAP, in addition I really wish that the Fisheye's Authentication was as mature as JIRA's.

- Change the "Synchronise Period" field to only accept numbers. (Right now, you can type "1 hou" and it will still accept it)
- Add an option to do an incremental sync is missing

fields.description:
Entering text like r43420 will create a hyperlink to Fisheye.  So will r43357, but in the latter case the link points to a page saying only "No changesets with that ID found. ". 

The problem is that the link is always points to the Fisheye repository associated with the current project, regardless of whether the commit was made within the scope of that project.  r43420 was within the /JST subdirectory and so the linked-to URL https://studio.atlassian.com/source/changelog/JST/?cs=43420 is correct.   r43357 was made within the /PLUG subdirectory and so the URL https://studio.atlassian.com/source/changelog/JST/?cs=43357 is incorrect.
fields.summary: Revision hyperlink URLs incorrect if revision is not within current project

fields.description:
When dealing with a Git repository with Fisheye when viewing a given changeset Fisheye seems to show the full username and e-mail address on the left hand side, which takes up a huge amount of space (I know it can be removed from the view though). Moreover the e-mail address doesn't really seem to be protected (for example with MailHide API).
Also it seems that the links generated for the users also contain the e-mail address, which I think should be quite easy to gather by SPAM bots. I should note that my Git user is not mapped to an actual Fisheye user and we're using JIRA as the backend for LDAP.
Did I miss a setting in Fisheye regarding e-mail addresses, or is this a bug?

(unfortunately changing the email visibility setting under Admin > Authentication Settings to hidden didn't have any effect, I can still see the e-mail addresses of the committers (I think Fisheye combines the user name with the e-mail and uses that as a user id).
fields.summary: Hiding e-mail addresses on changeset pages

fields.description:
When upgrading FishEye from 2.3.3 to 2.10.3, FishEye become unresponsive when accessing dashboard ( / ) or people ( /users ) pages.

There are only 3 initial indexing threads in the server.
When 3 repo started, it will perform indexing and the server is still working.
However, if more than 3 repo is started, the server hung.

Found the following stacktrace through DynaTrace when the server hung:
{noformat}
RepositoryHandle.acquireEngine()
  CommiterUserMappingManagerImpl.getImplicitCommitersForUserInRep(String, User)
{noformat} 

Could be related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-3932

fields.description:
Currently, when using [external authentication|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Configuring+External+Authentication+Sources], there is an option "Auto-add users into FishEye" for JIRA/Crowd AND LDAP, that adds a user automatically to Fisheye upon successfully authentication when logging in. This user will also be added to Crucible at the same time. However, this leads to a problem if that user does not need access to Crucible.
The workaround is to manually go through the user list and disable Crucible for those users who don't need access to it. To prevent this, a property/checkbox called "Do not automatically add users to Crucible" would be handy when using external authentication.
fields.summary: Checkbox to allow/prevent automatically adding users into Crucible

fields.description: If client's request is taking too long to process (see FE-4438 for an example), and user interrupts the operation (pressing 'stop' in the browser), the internal transaction (worker thread) is not terminated and will run to completion.  A user may repeat this (accidentally or on purpose) several times, and thus consume server resources, possibly leading to a DoS.
fields.summary: Internal transactions are not interrupted when client goes away

fields.description:
The application fails to restrict access to pages other than ones stored in the /secure/admin directory.
Pages under the views and source folder are accessible to an unauthenticated user, most of them are harmless but some open up the attack surface for an attacker.
Examples:

https://studio.atlassian.com/source/user/sysadmin
http://pentest.jira.com/source/users/
https://ebaymobile.jira.com/source/rest-service/users-v1/

We recommend to deny access to any path until a user has successfully logged in.

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to *Crowd Admin > Current Sessions > User Sessions* and clear all the sessions (excluding the admin user that you are currently logging in)
# Set up a Crucible instance that authenticates against Crowd
# Synchronize Crucible with Crowd in *Crucible Admin > Authentication*

h4. Expected Results
No sessions are created upon syncing (only the session of admin accessing Crucible is created)

h4. Actual Results
All sessions for all users that have access to Crucible are created
!screenshot009.jpg!

Crowd 2.6
Crucible 2.10.2
No SSO is configured

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Fisheye will associate users automatically with authors if the username/email match.
However, users have to manually configure the mapping for each repository if the names don't match - this can be tedious if you have several repositories.

h3. Suggested Solution
It should be possible to map multiple repositories with committers in one screen as its likely that customers have split up a large repository into several smaller repositories for performance reasons.
fields.summary: Configurable user/committer mapping across multiple repositories

fields.description:
Currently, Fisheye will associate users automatically with authors if the username/email match.
However, users have to manually configure the mapping for each repository if the names don't match - this can be tedious if you have several repositories.

It should be possible to map multiple repositories with committers in one screen as its likely that customers have split up a large repository into several smaller repositories for performance reasons.
fields.summary: Configurable user/committer mapping across multiple repositories

fields.description:
If an LDAP filter is configured in repository defaults (not possible to set one up since 2.4, but if one was configured before 2.4 and the instance was upgraded then it will remain in the config.xml and still be respected) then an LDAP query will be made for each repository when rendering the dashboard activity stream.

There is dead time (time for which nothing is being logged) between each query that can grow to 500ms+ per query if a lot of LDAP queries are being made.  This is a severe performance hit for large instances.
fields.summary: investigate and fix dead time in LDAP queries

fields.description:
Nowadays only commits containing references to JIRA issue keys are listed in JIRA's Source tab.

Many customers, when they start using FishEye integrated with JIRA, already have repositories with historic commits. These commits won't show up in JIRA' Source tab, as they don't contain a JIRA issue key in their commit messages. Only new commits from that time onwards mentioning JIRA issue keys will show up in JIRA's Source tab. It would be great if historic commits showed up in JIRA's source tab as well.

A suggestion to achieve this is to add a field next to each commit message in FishEye Activity Stream that allows to add the JIRA issue key.

The JIRA FishEye Plugin would need to be updated as well in order to search for these fields.
fields.summary: Manually add JIRA issue reference to changesets

fields.description:
Git merges are including the Smart Commits message from previous commits. Because of that it is possible to have reviews created twice (or other action triggered) because FishEye relies on the commit hash to check if a Smart Commit has been triggered or not.

We should rely instead on the commit message instead of the hash to see if a Smart Commits has already been activated.
fields.summary: Identify Smart Commits by commit messages to prevent them from being triggered twice

fields.description: FishEye's permission cache is not flushed immediately. Users' permissions for a repository are effective for 2+ minutes after they are added or removed to a group which has access to that repository.
fields.summary: FishEye's Permission Cache Is Not Flushed Immediately

fields.description: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+Documentation+Home and https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Crucible+Documentation+Home link to "Using smart commits" for no reason – they should link to "Using FishEye" and "Using Crucible" instead.
fields.summary: Replace 'Using smart commits' in Documentation Home

fields.description: BoneCP: connectionTestStatement for MySQL is /* ping */ SELECT 1 and reference material is for that http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/connector-j-usagenotes-j2ee-concepts-connection-pooling.html#connector-j-examples-connectionpool-j2ee
fields.summary: BoneCP: connectionTestStatement for MySQL

fields.description: Smart commits can now populate review objectives: doc should say that 'populate' means 'copy from commit message' – can't specify arbitrary objectives.
fields.summary: Documentation Should Indicate That 'populate' Means 'copy from commit message'

fields.description: Indexing hooks for Bitbucket and GitHub: one screenshot in release notes != documentation
fields.summary: Indexing Hooks for Bitbucket and GitHub

fields.description: Undocumented "Subversion Details" feature (shows versioned and unversioned properties) – see f.e. https://fisheye2.atlassian.com/changelog/SVNKit
fields.summary: Undocumented "Subversion Details" Feature

fields.description: UPM's "Plugin Requests" feature is not supported (or very well hidden), but the UI to enable/disable it is present.
fields.summary: Make UPM's Plugin Requests Available From GUI

fields.description:
According to the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Viewing+the+changelog#Viewingthechangelog-Filteringcommitactivityinthechangelog] the *End Date* field should show changesets created on or before the date specified.

However, it is actually showing changesets created before the date specified only.

Please see screenshots for more details.
fields.summary: End Date on Filter Commits not working correctly

fields.description:
Hi there,

We noticed that when more than one file is committed on the same revision using SVN, only the first item on the list for that revision shows the author.

It would be nice if it showed the author for each item on the list.
See the screenshot for more details.
fields.summary: Fisheye search does not show author name for all files in the same revision

fields.description:
Creating on behalf of customer from SAC:
{noformat}


Our production instance is proxied by nginx, which also caches all cacheable responses. Nginx is configured to log 'cache status' for each request – whether it was served from cache (HIT) or from upstream (MISS or EXPIRED). EXPIRED means that response was found in the cache but its TTL had expired.

Since the beginning of this year, there were 300940 requests to /avatar. Breakdown by cache status:

MISS 5498
HIT 77272
EXPIRED 218170

Note the share of EXPIRED requests. CPU time taken to process them could have been spent in other ways.

Please raise the max-age for avatars or make it configurable.

{noformat}
fields.summary: Make avatar cache TTL configurable

fields.description: Instead of the dots, something to indicate that it is closed would be appreciated.  If the tip was a different shape, that would make it a lot easier to look through the graph.
fields.summary: In the graph view I would like closed branches to look different than open branches

fields.description:
[This doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Git+Client] lacks all steps on how to set the Git executable path. 
It would help to have steps and screenshots on how to set this path under {{Administration -> Server -> Git Executable}}.
Also the [Git configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Git] doc does not have the above as a pre-requisite. The Git executable path should be added to it to help avoid [such exceptions|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-4543].
fields.summary: Git client doc does not have any instructions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When adding a repository, Fisheye returns:
{noformat}
Error testing connection.
Error talking to repository
{noformat}

In the following conditions:
- the Git executable path is not set
- Git is not installed

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the message returned by the user interface when Git is not available.
Fisheye should check for Git to be available when trying to add a Git repository.

h3. Additional details
If the path to Git executable is not set, FECRU will report following error on the UI, when testing repository connection:
{noformat}


    Fisheye is using '/usr/bin/ssh' to authenticate with SSH authenticated repositories.

    Error testing connection.
    Error talking to repository:

    at com.atlassian.fisheye.git.GitScmConfig.testConnection(GitScmConfig.java:143)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.RepositoryConfig.testConnection(RepositoryConfig.java:444)
    at com.atlassian.fisheye.spi.admin.impl.DefaultRepositoryAdminService.testConnectionFor(DefaultRepositoryAdminService.java:553)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)

fields.summary: Improve error reporting if path to Git executable is not set or Git is not installed

fields.description:
Today it's impossible to disallow users from downloading raw files.
Some customers may like to deny downloads for some users, so if the user can set an option to disallow raw files downloads, this problem will be solved.
fields.summary: Option to disable raw downloads

fields.description: FishEye needs to have some level of branch-level support. This is particularly important for a source control system like git, since unlike in Subversion or Perforce, it's not possible to index only certain branches via a different path.
fields.summary: Per-branch indexing permissions

fields.description:
When viewing the source for a file in FishEye in Firefox 18/19 the line numbers drift when displayed so the actual code lines are not aligned with [the line numbers displayed|^screenshot1.png].

However (due to infinite scrolling) every hundred lines there is a gap where the alignment is reset and it gets aligned for the first lines until it drifts again.
fields.summary: Source Code Line Numbers Misaligned on Firefox

fields.description:
Under {{Administration > User Settings > User Mappings}} it would be nice to have a the "Add new user" form before the listing in order to not have to scroll down the list.

Similarly, for Adding a new user.
fields.summary: Put the New User Mapping Form Before List of User Mapping

fields.description: Under {{Administration > User Settings > User Mappings}} it would be nice to be able to [filter the User Mappings table per field|^screenshot1.png].
fields.summary: Filter Fields for User Mappings Table

fields.description:
FishEye/Crucible does not suddenly stop sending email:
{noformat}
2013-02-27 15:28:48,333 DEBUG [notificationManager1 ] fisheye.mail Mailer$2-log - .
2013-02-27 15:28:48,547 DEBUG [notificationManager1 ] fisheye.mail Mailer$2-log - 250 2.0.0 r1RFTGvA014449 Message accepted for delivery
2013-02-27 15:28:48,548 DEBUG [notificationManager1 ] fisheye.mail Mailer$2-log - QUIT
2013-02-27 15:28:48,560 DEBUG [notificationManager1 ] fisheye.mail Mailer$2-log - 221 2.0.0 mail.server.com closing connection
2013-02-27 15:28:48,560 INFO  [notificationManager1 ] fisheye.mail Mailer-send - Sent: to=[admin@admin.com],from=[admin + 4 others <no-reply-crucible@admin.com>],subject=''[Crucible] Finished reviewing: (TEST-238) TEST-1963: test'
...
2013-02-27 15:28:55,848 DEBUG [notificationManager1 ] fisheye.mail Mailer$2-log - .
{noformat}
According to the log, after sending the email notification on 2013-02-27 15:28:48,560, FishEye try to send another email. However, there is no reply after the dot and the notification thread hang waiting for the reply.
fields.summary: Allow Mailer to have a configurable connection and socket timeout when sending email

fields.description: Snippets -- neither {{/project/CR}} nor {{/cru/browse/CR}} expose a list of snippets in the CR project. It's not possible to search for them either.
fields.summary: Expose List of Snippets in Projects

fields.description: Reviews -- add content to review -> search: if 'Author, Tags, Branch, Date, and more' was shown and anything was entered, keep it shown.
fields.summary: Search in Reviews

fields.description: In {{/qsearch}} the field name is not kept in the search box. For example: Search for "committer:foo" and see that search box now contains only "foo".
fields.summary: Field Name Is Not Kept in Search Box in Quick Search

fields.description: In {{/chart}}, the radio buttons' state resets to default when 'Apply' is clicked. For example: Select 'Break down by: Subdirectory', click 'Apply', that 'Subdirectory' is not selected.
fields.summary: Radio Buttons Reset When 'Apply' Is Pressed

fields.description: In Chart, radio buttons'state resets to default when Apply is clicked -- f.e. select 'Break down by: Subdirectory', click Apply, see that 'Subdirectory' is not selected.
fields.summary: Issue with radio buttons in Chart

fields.description: In {{/chart}}, [selecting "Area"|^screenshot1.png] immediately switches to that type (without need to "Apply").
fields.summary: Chart Issue When Selecting 'Area'

fields.description: In {{/changelog}} it is not possible to filter commits by '%' or '\+' in log message without hacks.  F.e. entering a single '%' character leads to error message: "java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - URLDecoder: Incomplete trailing escape (%) pattern" and '\+' is treated as space.
fields.summary: Cannot Filter Commits by '%' or '\+' in Log Message
Indicate that 'fisheyectl.sh fullscan' is only available for CVS repositories

fields.description:
h4.Steps to reproduce
# Enable email debug logging at {{Administration >> Global Settings >> Server >> Mail Server}}
# Set the User Settings so that email will be sent for own action
# Perform some action (close or reopen) to a review to send email notification
# Go to a review and click on {{Tools >> Email Review}} 
# Wait for the email to be received
# Check the log for the mail debug logging
The log does not have the mail debug logging

If send test email, the mail debug logging will appear in the log.

h4.Workaround
# Enable email debug logging at {{Administration >> Global Settings >> Server >> Mail Server}}
# Edit {{log4j.xml}}:
{noformat}
    <logger name="fisheye.mail">
        <level value="debug"/>
    </logger>
{noformat}
# Restart FishEye/Crucible
fields.summary: Email debug logging not working

fields.description:
Tags currently show at the right of the commit message, which is too far away from the branch it belongs to.
I would rather see the tag beside the commit dot on the branches column, as in the attached screenshot:
!tag.png!
fields.summary: Tags on the commit graph should be placed beside the commit dot (on the branch colum)

fields.description:
We are trialing Jira 5.1.6 and Fisheye 2.9.1 to make use of the Smart Commits functionality.  I have it mostly working except that it does not populate the work log description on commit.  I can use the #comment without a problem and the #time command creates a new work log with the correct time value, but never populates the work log description.

Here is an example of a commit message: "MCF-1 #time 1m one more final test".  The new work log entry is created for 1 minutes of time for the issue MCF-1, but the text that proceeds '1m' is not applied. 

(Some of the wording of the original bug has been reworded to match my use case here)
fields.summary: Work Log Description Not Populated with Smart Commit

fields.description:
When viewing commits of a GIT repository in the Commit Graph view, tags don't show.
I saw FE screenshots where tags appear at the right of the commit message (maybe for SVN repositories), so I wonder if this is not working with GIT repos.
fields.summary: Git tags don't show in commit graph view
